text.__SUMMARY__: Tropidophis bucculentus, the Navassa Island dwarf boa, was a nonvenomous dwarf boa species endemic to Navassa Island. No subspecies are currently recognized.
text.Geographic range: The type locality given is "Navassa Id."
text.Description: Preserved museum specimens indicate that it varied in size from 30–60 cm (0.98–1.97 ft).
text.Conservation status: Extinct. The species became a casualty of human interference and feral predators, such as rodents, cats, dogs, and goats that were introduced during the large-scale mining period on this small island during the 1800s.
